title: Beard vs. No Beard: What Are the Pros & Cons?

steps.title: Confidence
steps.content: Confidence Above all else, many men agree that having a beard makes them more confident. In one study, psychologists found that men with beards were considered more attractive than those who were clean-shaven. [1] X Research source Even so, attractiveness and confidence are subjective, and what might make one man confident might not make you confident.

steps.title: Convenience
steps.content: Convenience Not needing to shave every day can make your morning routine that much easier. Some men argue that having a beard trims their hygiene routine in half, mainly because they only have to touch up their beard every now and then. With this, some argue that having a beard is also more cost-effective because razors don’t need to be purchased as often. Although you may not need to shave every day, dermatologists still recommend washing your face and beard every day. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Skin health
steps.content: Skin health Shaving every day can irritate your skin. So, if you have sensitive skin or experience irritation or redness every time you shave your face, a beard may be a suitable option for you. Along with this, some studies have shown that beards can help protect your face from sun damage. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Skin irritation
steps.content: Skin irritation While beards can benefit those with sensitive skin, they could also harm them. For some, beards can irritate and exacerbate dry and flaky skin. The facial hair may cause itchiness, discomfort, and worsen a man’s overall skin condition. [4] X Research source Talk to your dermatologist if you have sensitive, dry, or acne-prone skin and want to grow a beard. They’ll be able to provide solutions to fit your needs. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Maintenance
steps.content: Maintenance Although beards don’t require daily shaving, they require a fair amount of upkeep. It’s extremely important to take care of your facial hair, especially if you want to avoid future skin problems. For a healthy beard: [6] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Wash your face and beard daily with a gentle cleanser and lukewarm water. Moisturize daily to help soften your skin and beard hairs. Groom your beard with a detangling brush or comb to remove tangles. Trim your beard regularly to keep it looking healthy and maintained.

steps.title: Messiness
steps.content: Messiness While beards may look cool, the harsh reality is that they can get quite messy. Having facial hair isn’t for the faint of heart. Food, sweat, and grime can get caught in the hair. Because of this, it’s essential to wash your beard every day (or throughout the day whenever it gets dirty), which may be too much upkeep for some. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Clean-shaven is ideal if you're going for a polished or preppy look.
steps.content: Clean-shaven is ideal if you're going for a polished or preppy look. This style means no facial whatsoever—that means no beard, mustache, or stubble. Many men (and their partners) prefer this look because it keeps their skin soft and smooth. If you have sensitive, dry, or acne-prone skin, a clean-shaven look may be best for you because it removes an extra cause of irritation (facial hair). You may also look quite a bit younger if you go with the clean-shaven look.

steps.title: Try the clean-shaven look if you don't mind shaving your face regularly.
steps.content: Try the clean-shaven look if you don't mind shaving your face regularly. If you enjoy the habit of shaving, a clean-shaven look may be perfect for you. Keep in mind that frequent shaving comes with risks, too, especially if you have sensitive skin. Razor bumps or burns, ingrown hairs, and irritation can still occur if you don’t shave correctly. [8] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Follow these steps for a clean-shaven look : Exfoliate before shaving. Use an exfoliator on your beard and face at least a week before you shave to help unclog your pores and soften your skin. [9] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Never dry shave. Always apply a shaving cream or gel before you shave to avoid skin irritation. [10] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Shave in the direction your facial hair grows. This helps prevent razor burns and bumps. Rinse your razor after each swipe. This cleans your razor and ensures the closest shave possible. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Apply a moisturizer or beard oil immediately after shaving. This helps lock in moisture and rehydrate your skin and hair.

steps.title: Men are growing out their beards for appearance and health.
steps.content: Men are growing out their beards for appearance and health. While every man grows a beard for personal reasons, the thought process can be narrowed down to 2 things: appearances and health. Some men choose to grow a beard because they believe it’s manlier or suits their overall look better, whereas others follow the trend because it’s ideal for their skin. Historically, beards were extremely popular in the 1880s, with most men rocking facial hair. The trend dipped off by the 1900s; however, in recent years, it has gained a resurgence thanks to social media trends and rugged movie stars rocking awesome beards. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Whether or not women like beards is all subjective.
steps.content: Whether or not women like beards is all subjective. There’s no right answer to if women collectively like or dislike beards. After all, physical attraction is all about personal preferences! [13] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Some women may find men with beards more attractive than those who are clean-shaven, while others may not—it’s truly a toss up. One study showed that some women associate facial hair with the ability to be a better father or protector, which may result in a greater attraction. [14] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source

steps.title: Whether you rock a bearded or clean-shaven style is up to you.
steps.content: Whether you rock a bearded or clean-shaven style is up to you. Both bearded and clean-shaven looks require upkeep and maintenance. Choose whichever style works best for you and your skin and lifestyle, whether that’s a bushy beard or a clean-shaven chin! Basically, shave as often or as little as you’d like—there’s no right answer.
